document.docAuthor: Carrejo, Nancy, Obando, Ranulfo González, Casasola-González, José Arturo & García Aldrete, Alfonso N.
document.docTitle: Goja vavilovi Carrejo & Obando & Casasola-González & García Aldrete 2021, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: New Colombian Goja Navás (Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’: Epipsocidae) with peculiar genitalia, and the first Goja with brachypterous male, from Oaxaca, Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Colombian Goja Navás (Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’: Epipsocidae) with peculiar genitalia, and the first Goja with brachypterous male, from Oaxaca, Mexico

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Head pattern similar to that of
G. tenerife
n. sp.
, differing from it in the wing venation, in the median posterior process of the hypandrium, in the posterior processes of the aedeagal arch and in the endophallic sclerites (compare Figs 34-35 with Figs 46-47 , Figs 38 with 50, and Figs 39 with 51 in this paper). Unlike
G. meremberg
n.

sp. ,
G. tenerife
n. sp.
, and
G. garridoi
n. sp.
, it presents the mesal endopallic sclerites distally widened, the right one somewhat similar to that of
G. mereberg
n. sp.
, but without an elongated apical process.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 40‒45.
Goja vallecaucana
n. sp.
Male. 40 . Forewing. 41 . Hindwing. 42 . Front view of head. 43 . Left paraproct and epiproct. 44 . Hypandrium. 45 . Phallosome. Scales in mm.

FIGURES 46‒51.
Goja vavilovi
n. sp.
Male. 46 . Forewing. 47 . Hindwing. 48 . Front view of head. 49 . Left paraproct and epiproct. 50 . Hypandrium. 51 . Phallosome. Scales in mm.

FIGURES 52‒56.
Goja vavilovi
n. sp.
Female. 52 . Winglet. 53 . Front view of head. 54 . Left paraproct and epiproct. 55 . Subgenital plate. 56 . Ninth sternum and left gonapophyses. Scales in mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Color (in 80% ethanol). Body, head ( Fig. 53 ), legs, epiproct and paraprocts as in the male, plus the following: Forewings cream, posterior margin brown; subgenital plate brown. Gonapophyses pale brown, distal process brown. IX sternum yellowish.

Specimens studied.
Holotype male. COLOMBIA . Valle del Cauca . Santiago de Cali , San Antonio, La Horqueta , 3°29’23.5”N : 76°37’39.4”W ,
2142 m
.,
23.V.2012
, R . González
.
Paratypes : 1 female , same data as the holotype
.
1 male ,
Santiago de Cali , Km.
18, road to Buenaventura , 03°30’38.3’’N , 76°37’13.8’’W ,
1990 m
.
27.I.2012
.
1 male , Jamundí , Mesetas , farm
El Diviso
,
2080 m
., undated, Alexander von Humboldt Institute , Malaise trap
.

Etymology. This species is dedicated to Nikolai Ivanovich Vavilov, a prominent botanist and geneticist, author of the theory on the centers of origin of cultivated plants and pioneer in the establishment of gene banks.
